title: Sean Diddy turns 55 in jail; gets fruit, breakfast cake in meal: Report
content: Diddy's lawyers have asked a judge to restrict statements made by potential witnesses and their lawyers outside of court and cited the name of Courtney Burgess who has given many interviews in recent days. The team filed the documents Sunday asking the judge to expedite the process of responding to Diddy's motion for a gag order.
summary: Diddy's lawyers have asked a judge to restrict statements made by potential witnesses and their lawyers outside of court and cited the name of Courtney Burgess who has given many interviews in recent days. The team filed the documents Sunday asking the judge to expedite the process of responding to Diddy's motion for a gag order.

title: Monica Lewinsky trolled for voting Kamala Harris in US election 2024: 'Party that called her a who*e'
content: When the scandal broke, Lewinsky agreed to immunity from prosecution with the attorney general and provided definitive proof of her intimate relationship with the president -- a dress stained with Clinton's semen. "I did have a relationship with Miss Lewinsky that was not appropriate," Clinton had to admit later though he denied the relationship initially.
summary: When the scandal broke, Lewinsky agreed to immunity from prosecution with the attorney general and provided definitive proof of her intimate relationship with the president -- a dress stained with Clinton's semen. "I did have a relationship with Miss Lewinsky that was not appropriate," Clinton had to admit later though he denied the relationship initially.

title: Early voting data a 'little scary' for Kamala Harris, says Ex-Obama campaign manager
content: Jim Messina, Obama's 2012 campaign manager, expressed concern over early voting trends showing a surge in Republican participation. While Democrats are witnessing promising turnout among women and young voters, Republicans appear to have improved their early voting strategy compared to the previous election, causing concern among Democrats but Messina said he thinks Harris is holding strong in the last leg of the campaign.
summary: Jim Messina, Obama's 2012 campaign manager, expressed concern over early voting trends showing a surge in Republican participation. While Democrats are witnessing promising turnout among women and young voters, Republicans appear to have improved their early voting strategy compared to the previous election, causing concern among Democrats but Messina said he thinks Harris is holding strong in the last leg of the campaign.

title: Massive outrage over Imane Khelif's leaked medical report: 'Democrats hate women'
content: Khelif's gender became an election issue as Donald Trump included Imane's example in an advertisement critiquing the Biden-Harris administration's approach to gender ad athletics. GOP politicians like Vivek Ramaswamy, JD Vance also expressed their opinion that they won't allow men in the female category sports. The leaked report added to the outrage a day before the crucial election.
summary: Khelif's gender became an election issue as Donald Trump included Imane's example in an advertisement critiquing the Biden-Harris administration's approach to gender ad athletics. GOP politicians like Vivek Ramaswamy, JD Vance also expressed their opinion that they won't allow men in the female category sports. The leaked report added to the outrage a day before the crucial election.

title: Nate Silver team's final prediction for US election: 'Polls are close, results might not be'
content: "...However, that doesn't mean the actual outcome will be all that close. If the polls are totally accurate we're in for a nail-biter on Tuesday night. But a systematic polling error is always possible, perhaps especially if you think pollsters are herding -- only publishing results that match the consensus. And because things are so close, even an average polling error would upend the state of the race," Silver Bulletin's latest poll said.
summary: "...However, that doesn't mean the actual outcome will be all that close. If the polls are totally accurate we're in for a nail-biter on Tuesday night. But a systematic polling error is always possible, perhaps especially if you think pollsters are herding -- only publishing results that match the consensus. And because things are so close, even an average polling error would upend the state of the race," Silver Bulletin's latest poll said.

title: Nikki Haley says she doesn't agree with Trump 100% of the time but...
content: "No politician gets everything right. For those of us clear-eyed enough to see Mr Trump’s flaws and honest enough to acknowledge them, the question is whether we’re better off with his policies or his opponent’s," GOP leader Nikki Haley wrote in an op-ed for the Wall Street Journal as she announced her support for Trump and said despite her differences with him, Trump is clearly a better choice.
summary: "No politician gets everything right. For those of us clear-eyed enough to see Mr Trump’s flaws and honest enough to acknowledge them, the question is whether we’re better off with his policies or his opponent’s," GOP leader Nikki Haley wrote in an op-ed for the Wall Street Journal as she announced her support for Trump and said despite her differences with him, Trump is clearly a better choice.

title: Putin meets North Korean foreign minister in Moscow
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with North Korean foreign minister Choe Son Hui in the Kremlin on Monday, Moscow announced, amid western claims that Russia plans to deploy thousands of Pyongyang's troops to the Ukraine conflict. "President Putin received the foreign minister of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Choe Son Hui," the Kremlin said in a statement, publishing a video of the pair shaking hands ahead of talks.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with North Korean foreign minister Choe Son Hui in the Kremlin on Monday, Moscow announced, amid western claims that Russia plans to deploy thousands of Pyongyang's troops to the Ukraine conflict. "President Putin received the foreign minister of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Choe Son Hui," the Kremlin said in a statement, publishing a video of the pair shaking hands ahead of talks.

title: John Oliver chokes up as he urges voters to elect Kamala Harris: 'I am an immigrant'
content: ​“Look, I love this country. I’m an immigrant. I chose to be here. In the words of the late, great Lee Greenwood: I’m proud to be an American. And I’d argue there is nothing more American than having a healthy, adversarial relationship with those in power, even if you voted for them," John Oliver said urging his audience to vote for Kamala Harris.
summary: ​“Look, I love this country. I’m an immigrant. I chose to be here. In the words of the late, great Lee Greenwood: I’m proud to be an American. And I’d argue there is nothing more American than having a healthy, adversarial relationship with those in power, even if you voted for them," John Oliver said urging his audience to vote for Kamala Harris.

title: GOP strategist says all pollsters are getting US election wrong as they overlooked this shift
content: GOP strategist Alex Castellanos argued that polls underestimate Republican enthusiasm, citing a surge in Republican voter registration. ​“I think the pollsters are getting this wrong. We’re all missing something, because they’re giving us the same poll over and over again. There isn’t even statistical variation,” Castellanos said. ​The final NYT/Sienna poll said it will be a photo finish in the seven swing states -- Harris showing new strength in North Carolina and Georgia and Trump erasing her lead in Pennsylvania and maintaining his advantage in Arizona.
summary: GOP strategist Alex Castellanos argued that polls underestimate Republican enthusiasm, citing a surge in Republican voter registration. ​“I think the pollsters are getting this wrong. We’re all missing something, because they’re giving us the same poll over and over again. There isn’t even statistical variation,” Castellanos said. ​The final NYT/Sienna poll said it will be a photo finish in the seven swing states -- Harris showing new strength in North Carolina and Georgia and Trump erasing her lead in Pennsylvania and maintaining his advantage in Arizona.

title: Top Hezbollah commander Abu Ali Rida 'eliminated' in air strike, says Israel
US Presidential Election Results: All you need to know including key states, candidates and voting dates
content: The US presidential election is in its final stage, with Kamala Harris and Donald Trump vying for victory. Seven swing states, including Arizona, Georgia, and Pennsylvania, are expected to determine the election's outcome. With millions of Americans already casting their votes, the race remains tight, with polls showing a near tie between Harris and Trump in these crucial states.
summary: The US presidential election is in its final stage, with Kamala Harris and Donald Trump vying for victory. Seven swing states, including Arizona, Georgia, and Pennsylvania, are expected to determine the election's outcome. With millions of Americans already casting their votes, the race remains tight, with polls showing a near tie between Harris and Trump in these crucial states.

title: US Elections: Why 'YMCA' became a staple in Trump's MAGA rally
content: Donald Trump ends his rallies with the 1978 disco hit 'YMCA,' using it as a campaign anthem. This choice resonates with his supporters, despite its origins in LGBT culture. Victor Willis of the Village People has dropped objections to the song's use, acknowledging its popularity boost. The song's nostalgia appeals to Trump's base, tapping into a youthful spirit.
summary: Donald Trump ends his rallies with the 1978 disco hit 'YMCA,' using it as a campaign anthem. This choice resonates with his supporters, despite its origins in LGBT culture. Victor Willis of the Village People has dropped objections to the song's use, acknowledging its popularity boost. The song's nostalgia appeals to Trump's base, tapping into a youthful spirit.

title: Texas mother arrested after attempted sale of her unborn baby on Facebook
content: Juniper Bryson, 21, from Texas, has been arrested for trying to sell her baby on Facebook. She posted in a group seeking adoptive parents for her unborn baby, requesting payment to aid in moving into an apartment and getting her life back on track. The situation was reported to authorities, leading to her arrest.
summary: Juniper Bryson, 21, from Texas, has been arrested for trying to sell her baby on Facebook. She posted in a group seeking adoptive parents for her unborn baby, requesting payment to aid in moving into an apartment and getting her life back on track. The situation was reported to authorities, leading to her arrest.

title: 'I shouldn't have left': Trump revisits 2020 election defeat, says he wouldn't mind if someone shot through 'fake news' to get him
China's marriage registrations fall by almost a million in 2024
'I will invoke the Aliens Enemy Act': Trump at final Georgia rally
content: Donald Trump concluded his final rally in Georgia, emphasizing his plans to invoke the Alien Enemies Act and pursue the death penalty for undocumented immigrants who commit crimes. He criticized former military generals and assured supporters that he would address inflation and immigration issues if elected. Trump's message focused on rallying votes and addressing national concerns.
summary: Donald Trump concluded his final rally in Georgia, emphasizing his plans to invoke the Alien Enemies Act and pursue the death penalty for undocumented immigrants who commit crimes. He criticized former military generals and assured supporters that he would address inflation and immigration issues if elected. Trump's message focused on rallying votes and addressing national concerns.

title: 'Trump's health policy plans put millions at risk': Harris on 'Check up with Dr Mike' podcast
content: Kamala Harris addressed healthcare policies on 'The Check Up with Dr Mike', criticizing Donald Trump's plan to have RFK Jr work on women's health if he wins. She emphasized the stakes of the upcoming election, urging voters to support her to protect the Affordable Care Act and ensure competent healthcare leadership.
summary: Kamala Harris addressed healthcare policies on 'The Check Up with Dr Mike', criticizing Donald Trump's plan to have RFK Jr work on women's health if he wins. She emphasized the stakes of the upcoming election, urging voters to support her to protect the Affordable Care Act and ensure competent healthcare leadership.

title: Mount Laki-Laki volcano erupts in Indonesia; 9 killed
Storm alerts issued for Jamaica, Cuba, and US as potential tropical cyclone set to become hurricane
content: A weather system in the south-central Caribbean Sea is expected to intensify. Tropical storm warnings are issued for Jamaica and a hurricane watch for the Cayman Islands. The storm could bring heavy rain and flooding to Jamaica, the Cayman Islands, and may impact Cuba, the Florida Keys, and the southeastern US.
summary: A weather system in the south-central Caribbean Sea is expected to intensify. Tropical storm warnings are issued for Jamaica and a hurricane watch for the Cayman Islands. The storm could bring heavy rain and flooding to Jamaica, the Cayman Islands, and may impact Cuba, the Florida Keys, and the southeastern US.

title: Watch: Officers throw punches in Georgia-Florida game chaos
content: During the Georgia-Florida college football game at EverBank Stadium, disturbing scenes unfolded as two police officers were seen repeatedly striking different supporters in the stands. The Jacksonville Sheriff's Office announced administrative reviews, investigating the incidents caught on video. Georgia secured a comeback victory over Florida, finalizing the score with a dominant second-half performance.
summary: During the Georgia-Florida college football game at EverBank Stadium, disturbing scenes unfolded as two police officers were seen repeatedly striking different supporters in the stands. The Jacksonville Sheriff's Office announced administrative reviews, investigating the incidents caught on video. Georgia secured a comeback victory over Florida, finalizing the score with a dominant second-half performance.
